Literature Review: Molecular monitoring of lymphomas has emerged as a crucial tool in the clinical management of these cancers. The high cell-free DNA and circulating tumor DNA concentrations, high somatic mutational burden, and the existence of stereotyped variants in lymphomas make them well-suited for molecular surveillance. This review aims to summarize the current evidence in the literature regarding molecular subtyping and classification, evaluation of treatment response, surveillance of active cellular therapies, and emerging clinical trial strategies.
